messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Vaccines
messages.msgSnippet: ... http://www.new-atlantean.com/global/vaccine.html  has always been my choice when looking for books about vaccinations. Its very important you get the rule
messages.messageBody:
>Also, our family has a M.D. that only promotes four childhood vaccines.
>When
>our first child was born, I questioned him on school exemption letters,
>because I thought at the time that only some religions were allowed to
>object
>across the board. He told me that basically all religions have some
>guidelines such as "Don't harm your children", therefore, as long as you
>believe that by following your faith means not vaccinating, you can
>religiously object.
>
>Melinda in Illinois


http://www.new-atlantean.com/global/vaccine.html has always been my
choice when looking for books about vaccinations.

Its very important you get the rule for your state on this issue to make
sure that you are covered by any legalities.

Some states are more lenient than others as to recognizing all religions.
Some states require only certain religions.


regards,
kolleen
